sense.name: the activity of removing a resource
sense.commentary: DEPLETION[+activity][+removal][+resource] Note: implies an ongoing taking of resource by an agent/actor
sense.examples: The continued depletion of the ozone layer is causing concern among scientists. The land's value was diminished by depletion of its mineral deposits. The oil company got a tax deduction for its gradual depletion of oil reserves.

sense.name: the state of having less resource
sense.commentary: DEPLETION[+state][+result][+decrease][+resource] Note: implies a resulting state of less of a resource, not the taking activity
sense.examples: Bob described his sudden depletions of energy to his doctor. John noticed a significant depletion of funds in his savings account on his last bank statement. The coroner's report stated that a depletion of oxygen in the room was the cause of asphyxiation.
